posts.title: React 101
posts.subtitle: Some basics to get you started with React
posts.body: React apps are build using components. These components are used to give you flexibility when writing code.

posts.title: Using JSX
posts.subtitle: JSX basics
posts.body: When writing your markup in react, you write it in JSX. This is very similar to HTML, but with some key differences. One difference to keep in mind is that JSX things expect a prop of className rather than class.

posts.title: Today is a great day
posts.subtitle: Reminder to be grateful
posts.body: Be grateful in all things that you do. It is important to stay grateful always and be thankful for the blessings you do have. If you are able to sleep in a bed, go without hunger, and walk on both feet, you have abundance in your life that deserves gratitude.

posts.title: Something you need to know about React
posts.subtitle: React is popular for a reason
posts.body: React allows you to build out SAPs with the help of reusable components. The modular nature of these components help you dynamically reuse parts of your code. In React components, you can write in JSX. It is not HTML, but it uses a similar syntax. You are also able to use the power of JavaScript is this 'not HTML' language, allowing endless possibilities.
